FuncDef:
The payload-compression dba command configures payload compression dynamic bandwidth allocation (DBA).
The undo payload-compression dba command restores the default configuration.
By default, payload compression DBA is not configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Sends DBA packets when unequipped circuit indications are detected.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In TDM transmission of CEP services, bandwidth is occupied no matter whether there is service data. If no service data is transmitted or only data with alarm indications (data with alarm indications is considered invalid data) is transmitted, bandwidth is wasted. To increase bandwidth utilization, run the payload-compression dba command to compress invalid data into DBA packets for transmission and dynamic bandwidth allocation.
Follow-up Procedure
Run the reset pw command to allow attributes in the PW template to take effect on the PW.
Precautions
The mpls static-l2vc or mpls l2vc command can also be used to configure payload compression DBA if payload-compression dba uneq is configured in the command. If the mpls static-l2vc or mpls l2vc command and the payload-compression dba command are run to configure payload compression DBA, the mpls static-l2vc or mpls l2vc command takes precedence over the payload-compression dba command.
